direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods involve modifying the composite map, with 'remove' removing a key-value pair and 'put' adding or updating a key-value pair.
Both methods modify the composite map, with 'remove' removing a specific key-value pair and 'clear' removing all key-value pairs.
Both methods involve modifying the composite map, with 'remove' removing a key-value pair and 'addComposited' adding a new map to the composite.
Both methods involve removing elements from the composite map, with 'remove' removing a specific key-value pair and 'removeComposited' removing an entire map from the composite.
The 'remove' method relies on 'containsKey' to determine if a key exists before attempting to remove it.
The 'remove' method could potentially use 'get' to retrieve the value associated with the key before removing it.
